message: Bob, I'm offering you my product for $1,400,000. This is a fair price considering the value it holds for you. I'm confident this will be a mutually beneficial deal. Let me know what you think.
I appreciate your offer, but I was thinking more along the lines of $1,200,000. I'm willing to meet you halfway and make a compromise. Can you consider this price?

Bob, I understand you're looking for a good deal, and I'm willing to work with you. However, $1,200,000 is significantly lower than the value I'm seeking.  How about we split the difference and settle on $1,300,000? This price still leaves room for you to profit and is fair to both of us.
I appreciate your willingness to compromise, but $1,300,000 is still a bit too high for me. I'm willing to meet you halfway again and propose $1,250,000. Can you consider this price?

Bob, I'm starting to feel like we're not going to be able to agree on a price.  $1,250,000 just doesn't work for me.  I'm willing to go down to $1,350,000 as a final compromise.  If you aren't willing to meet me halfway on this, I'm going to have to consider selling to John instead.
I understand your concerns, and I appreciate your willingness to compromise. However, $1,350,000 is still a bit too high for me. I'm willing to go down to $1,275,000. Can you consider this price?

Bob,  I'm finding it difficult to justify going any lower than $1,300,000. This price still represents a significant profit for you, and we're getting closer to a deal. If you're not willing to meet me here, I'm going to have to explore other options.

I understand your concerns, and I appreciate your willingness to work with me. However, I'm still not comfortable with $1,300,000. I'm willing to meet you halfway again and propose $1,275,000. Can you consider this price?
